snippet: President Obama’s advisers have indicated that they are eager to re-engage their opponents on their Medicare plan, while the Romney camp would prefer to talk about the economy.
abstract: President Obama begins a two-day campaign bus tour through central Florida, trying to turn the focus from jobs to Medicare in a state where there are a large number of retired and elderly voters; Obama's advisers have indicated they are eager to re-engage Mitt Romney and Paul D Ryan on their Medicare plan, while the Romney camp would prefer to talk about the economy.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Seminole, Fla., and Ashley Parker from Boston and Charlotte, N.C.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s advisers have indicated that they are eager to re-engage their opponents on their Medicare plan, while the Romney camp would prefer to talk about the economy.

headline.seo: Obama Tries to Move Focus From Jobs to Medicare
headline.main: Obama, Stumping in Florida, Tries to Turn Focus to Medicare From Jobs
headline.print_headline: Obama, Stumping in Florida, Tries to Turn Focus to Medicare From Jobs

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
